title: Big Cypress National Preserve: Park Statistics
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Management     Park Statistics              Park Statistics       National Park Service sites receive approximately 280 million visitors each year. The Public Use Statistics Office website provides historic and current visitor use statistics for 374 of the 400+ units included in the National Park System (statistics are not available for some areas; for example, those with joint administration of federal and non-federal lands). Click here to be transferred to the National Park Service Public Use Statistics Office.              Total land area for Rhode Island: 1,045 square milesTotal land area for Big Cypress National Preserve: 1,139 square miles   GROSS AREA 729,000 acres, or 1,139 square miles (roughly the size of Rhode Island).      VISITATION  2014 - 1,192,858 2013 - 1,005,074 2012 - 882,570 2011 - 941,393 2010 - 665,523 2009 - 812,207 2008 - 813,790 2007 - 822,864 2006 - 825,857 2005 - 768,687 2004 - 385,194 2003 - 400,902 2002 - 449,481 2001 - 409,771
